description: From Latin sēlēctus, perfect passive participle of sēligō (“choose out, select”), from sē- (“without; apart”) + legō (“gather, select”).

adjectives.description: select (comparative more select, superlative most select)

examples: Only a select few were allowed into the premiere.
This is a select cut of beef.

verbs.description: select (third-person singular simple present selects, present participle selecting, simple past and past participle selected)

entries.meaning: To choose one or more elements of a set, especially a set of options.
examples: He looked over the menu, and selected the roast beef.
The program computes all the students' grades, then selects a random sample for human verification.

entries.meaning: (databases) To obtain a set of data from a database using a query.
